ovdesc.p: The Company file contains details of the Company's name, the Mnemonic (by which all the files maintain at this company's level are prefixed), the file classification details, the applications to be run and Company level defaults and parameters.
The Reverse (R) function is not allowed for a company record. The input, copy, delete, authorise, see and print functions are all available.
This application is invoked from one of two sources:
(a) Automatically from within the installation process for the loading of a new processing company record.
(b) On-line to enable amendment or enquiry and the loading of a new Consolidation Company record.
The procedures for setting up a new processing company are explained in the Installation guide.
For reporting purposes a Consolidation Company may be required. A Consolidation Company could be used to cover something like a Continent/ Region, that is a non-existing Company.

Once a Company record has been loaded it is possible On-line to amend certain fields and also to view each field, whether input, internal or externally maintained, together with the associated field level help-text.
There are 3 types of non consolidation company record, all of which can produce a full set of financail reports.
The Master company is the very first company installed on the system (usually BNK).
A Lead company is a company that owns its own financial files, (the Master company is a Lead Company). A lead company is the equivalent of a company in a multi company set up.
A Branch company is linked to a Lead company and uses the same data files as its Lead company with the exception of financial reporting files.
The type of company is determined when the company is created via the COMPANY.CREATE application.
Files containing financial records are kept separate for each Company, but can be combined, for reporting purposes.
The non-financial data files can be shared with other companies or can be separate depending upon the details loaded for the Company.
The standard name of this file is COMPANY.

desc.p: Identifies the region in the country in which the company is physically situated. This field is mainly used where the holidays in one part of the resident country differ from those in other parts.
This field represents the region of the country in which the company is resident. The contents will be used extensively within various validation processes at the application level.
Note :
1. TEMENOS recommend that you adopt the SWIFT standard conventions for Country, Region and Currency.
2. Users should note that within T24 there is no requirement for a correlation between LOCAL.COUNTRY/LOCAL.REGION and LOCAL.CURRENCY.
3 or 4 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
a) Country code - 2 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters.
b) Region code - 1 or 2 numeric characters.
(Mandatory input if LOCAL COUNTRY is not entered, otherwise not allowed.)
The code must be the ID of an existing record in the REGION table.
This field is mutually exclusive with LOCAL.COUNTRY.
Indicates under which company the Financial Static table files are maintained for this Company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record already existing or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details re file structure.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default = COMPANY.CODE. After the record has been authorised, this is a no change field.
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company maintains the Nostro accounts used by this company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9 or A-Z uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)
Indicates which company maintains the Nostro accounts used by this company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record which is linked to the same company at the Customer level files or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details re file structure.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default = COMPANY.CODE. After the record has been authorised, this is a no change field.
Contains the code that represents the country in which the this company is physically situated.
This field represents the country in which the company is resident. The contents will be used extensively within various validation processes.
Note : Temenos recommend that you adopt the SWIFT standard conventions for Country and Currency codes.
NO Input field, the value is defaulted from the first two characters of the OFFICIAL.HOLIDAY field.
2 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters.
The code will be the ID of an existing record in the COUNTRY table.
This field is mutually exclusive with LOCAL.REGION.
Identifies the language used for this Company.
This field will be used when there is an option to produce internal reports other than in English.
1-2 numeric characters. (Mandatory input) The code must be on the LANGUAGE Table.
Specifies the 6 characters of the S.W.I.F.T address to be used as part of the common reference for this company.

When sending S.W.I.F.T messages for deals between Banks one of the fields is called The Common Reference. This field is made up of 16 characters, which contain two sets of 6 characters separated by four characters from the exchange/interest rate.

The two sets of 6 characters are 6 characters from the S.W.I.F.T address for the two banks between whom the deal has been made. To save calculating it each time these 6 characters for this Company are stored in this field.
6 type SS (upper case alpha or numeric with first character alpha) characters. (Mandatory input) 6 characters must be entered.
Indicates the variance allowed when checking the conversion of amounts for which no override will be requested.
Value entered is in the local currency.
When on a Transaction (DATA.CAPTURE for example) two currency amounts are input, the system will check the calculation using the rate input or derived from the CURRENCY table.
If the difference, between the amount input and that calculated, when converted into local currency is less than or equal the amount entered here, then no override is necessary.
If the difference is greater than the amount entered here but less than or equal to the amount entered in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MAX then an override will be required.
If the difference is greater than the amount entered in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MAX then an error message will be displayed.
1-6 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters according to local currency. (Mandatory input)
This field defines the Business holiday table used by this company (or branch).
It can be different to the OFFCIAL.HOLIDAY table.
An example would be where the Official country working days
The branch working days could be Monday to Saturday (or even all 7 days) irrespective of Official public holidays.
The CURRENT.DAY field on the DATES record for the company will indicate the type of business day.
NORMAL the branch is open on an official working day
RESTRICTED the branch is open on an official holiday, e.g. a weekend or public holiday
CLOSED the branch is closed i.e. the holiday table for the branch indicates a non working day, or the day corresponds to a value on the BRNACH.CLOSED field for the company
It is possible to determine whether a VERSION can be run based on the value of the CURRENT.DAY, so that business activities can be restricted when a branch is open on an official holiday.
If the BRANCH.HOLIDAY is different to the OFFICIAL.HOLIDAY then the LOCAL.COUNTRY will be blank and the BRANCH.HOLIDAY will be used to populate the LOCAL.REGION field.
If they are the same then the first two characters of the OFFICIAL.HOLIDAY field will be used to populate the LOCAL.COUNTRY field and the LOCAL.REGION.FIELD will be blank.
Optional input, if no input is made it will default to the value of the OFFICIAL.HOLIDAY field
Must be a valid entry on the REGION table, i.e. a two character country code followed by 2 numeric characters
If only the 2 character country code is input then the field value will be appended with 00
Indicates the sub division code allocated to this company.
This code is used when building the internal account number for inter company accounting. This happens when Nostro Accounts are maintained in one company for use by other companies.
The internal account number is made up with the currency code from the Nostro account entry, the category code from the ACCOUNT.CLASS record INTERCO followed by a sub division code.

The sub division code, for the entry in this company's books, is the one from this field on the other company's company record and vice versa. In an Extended Multi Company setup internal accounts with be 16 characters long with the subdivsion code of the owning company comprising the last 4 characters of the key.
1-4 numeric characters. (Leading zeros will be added when required.) (Mandatory input). The value entered must be unique across all companies.
Specifies the applications where the next available record ID is to be calculated automatically when the function key F3 is used.
Only applications with sequential numeric record IDs or with standard transaction reference IDs are to be entered.

When running an application that has been entered here under the INPUT function and the FUNCTION KEY F3 is pressed at the awaiting ID prompt, then the next available record Id will be allocated for the new record to be input.
By using the optional suffix of 'space M' the auto ID function will be made mandatory for the application concerned. No user will be allowed to input a new record without using the function key F3.
Up to 40 characters - Valid application names only. 25 character application name with optional suffix 'space M' i.e. 'CUSTOMER M' Multivalue field. (Optional input. No default input.)
No duplicate application names may be entered.
Must be the name, or authorised abbreviation, of an existing on-line application.
Identifies the area to which the Statutory reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Statutory reports produced from the Reporting module.
Up to 30 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
Indicates whether the Buy and Sell Rates or the Middle Rate will be used for entering exchange rates into the system.

BUY.SELL.RATE means that the Buy and Sell Rates are entered and the Middle rates are calculated. MIDDLE.RATE means that the Middle Rates are entered and the system uses the Spread rates to calculate Buy and Sell rates.
1-13 type AAA (alpha) characters with the following values: M(IDDLE.RATE) B(UY.SELL.RATE) (Mandatory input)
Indicates under which company the Special Financial Static table file is maintained.
This field is only required if Financial Static Table file(s) are to be maintained under another Company to that input for the Default Financial Static Tables field 25.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record which already exists or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details regarding file structure.

2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.FIN.FILE to SPCL.FIN.MNE. Optional field; Default = COMPANY.CODE if SPCL.FIN.FILE has been entered.
Indicates whethter separate COB processing can be performed at lead company (or groups of lead companies) level
Y indicates that it is possible
NO not possible
This can only be input if the GP (Global Processing) product is installed.
Related to database file creattion
Indicates under which company the Financial Financial table files are maintained for this Company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and can not be changed.

The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record already existing, in which case the local currency must be the same as on this record, or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details re file structure.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default COMPANY.CODE. After the record has been authorised, this is a no change field.
Indicates under which company the Customer files are maintained for this company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record which already has Customer level files maintained for it or for the Company being loaded.
Note : The files in the system are grouped as follows:
Installation This covers files like Company, User, Language where more than one copy/ version of the file cannot be processed within one installation.
Customer This group is for files where the key is the customer number or customer number assumed, like the CUSTOMER.DEFAULT file, the LIMIT file.
Customer Tables This group is for the files that are used as checkfiles for customer level files.

Financial This group covers the files whose financial fields feed the financial base from which the chart of accounts is drawn. Also included are other files with the same key as the financial file(s). For example, financial files are ACCOUNT, FUNDS.TRANSFER, and LETTER.OF.CREDIT. Similar key files are ACCOUNT.STATEMENT, ACCOUNT.CREDIT.INT etc.
Financial Tables This group is for the files that are used as checkfiles for financial level files. The files in this group contain non financial data.
Financial Tables - Financial Files in this group are linked to financial level files and also contain financial level data. Example of files in this group are GROUP.DEBIT.INT, TAX, TRANSACTION
Currency This group is for the currency and associated files.
Nostro This group is for files that are held for Nostro accounts.
The installation level files will only be maintained at F. level. Therefore, no file mnemonics will be held on the COMPANY record for the installation level.
All other level files will not start with F. but will start with F followed by a company mnemonic then a full stop.
The company code and mnemonic for each level except the financial level are held on this file (COMPANY).

For the table levels there is a default company. For Customer tables and for Financial tables there is the opportunity for file(s) to be linked to a different Company from the default. When a special company is entered it is to be checked that its for the same or higher level. This latter facility is not available for Financial tables with Financial data on them.

The groups have been classified as follows on the FILE.CONTROL file as follows: INT - Installation CUS - Customer CST - Customer table FIN - Financial FTD - Financial Table Descriptive FTF - Financial Table Financial CCY - Currency NOS - Nostro
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default = COMPANY.CODE. After authorisation this is a no change field.
Identifies the location to which the Statutory reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Statutory reports produced from the Reporting module.
The purpose of this field is to indicate the Delivery point within the Company buildings. (e.g. floor/office number/reference).
Up to 10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Customer tables files are maintained if there are any for this company.
This field is only required if the Customer level files are to be maintained under the Company entered in COMPANY.CODE.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, A-Z, uppercase alpha) or '.' characters. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)

This field will be used by the Data Capture Application when the operator requests the automatic adjustment facility for the closing of a Data Capture batch. it is usedto ensure that the data capture item to be adjusted (rounded) is not greater than the value entered here.
The detailed use of this field, as well as various examples, can be found in the Data Capture System guide.
Standard Amount Format. Input mandatory when DC.TOLERANCE.RATE entered; otherwise not allowed.
The amount entered in this field cannot be greater than the amount input in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MAX.
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Customer files are maintained for this.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha) or '.' characters. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Special Customer table file is maintained.

This field is only required if the Customer level files are to be maintained under the Company entered in COMPANY.CODE, and Customer Table file(s) are to be maintained under another Customer level Company to that input for the Default Customer Tables.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, A-Z, uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.) Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.CUST.FILE to SPCL.CUST.COM.
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Financial Static table files are maintained for this Company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, A-Z, uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)
Indicates the maximum variance allowed when inputting an exchange rate when no variance has been loaded on the currency record.

This is the default Rate Allowance to be used when no rate allowance is entered on the currency record. Where a cross-rate has been calculated and there is an allowance rate on each of the Currency records, the Currency having the highest Ranking will be used.
An override is required when an Exchange Rate is entered and the variance to the existing Exchange Rate (Middle/Buy/Sell) is greater than the rate allowance.
1-6 numeric characters which can be separated by a '.' to indicate the decimal point. (Mandatory input)
Identifies the area to which the Company Management reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Management Information reports which are produced for the whole of the company rather than for a particular department/area.
Up to 30 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
This is the next financial year end with a twelve month frequency cycle. So at the end of each year the next year end can be calculated.
Also indicates the calculation period for charges.
Previous year end is stored in LAST.YEAR.END.
No input field. Year end is set in application PL.CLOSE.PARAMETER.
Provides an alternative means of referencing the company details and is used in the naming of the files belonging to this company.
The mnemonic code rather than the Company ID may be used to reference the company.
The mnemonic code is used in the prefix of the files created /belonging for/to this company.
The code cannot be amended as an amendment would require files to be renamed/copied.
2-3 type AA (alphanumeric, first character must be alpha) characters. (Mandatory input) Cannot be changed. The mnemonic code must be unique (no other company can have the same mnemonic value).
Determines which currency is used as the Base Currency of the Bank (company).
Must be the ID or the Numeric Ccy Code of an existing record on the CURRENCY table.
Is the currency against which the CURRENCY table rates are held and in which the Company's profit and loss is held and in which the Company's Trail Balance will net to zero.
3 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters or Up to 3 numeric characters. (Mandatory input) Unchangeable input.
Identifies the code by which the static details of the company can be accessed.
The standard format of Company Code is:
CCGGGLLLL Where: CC is Country Code GGG is Company Group Code LLLL is Local Code
a) Country code - Capital letters in the range A-Z. Must be the ID of an existing record in the COUNTRY table.
b) Company Group Code - 3 numeric characters in the range 001-999. Must be the ID of an existing record in the COMPANY.GROUP table.
c) Local Code - 4 numeric characters in the range 0001-9999.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format: CCGGGLLLL or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alpha ) or '.' characters. (Mandatory Input)
Contains the Name and Address of the Company for reporting and information.
This is the Address of the Company.
0-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Indicates whether contracts and accounts can be input for prospective customers in this company.
Input is enabled when the CR (Customer Relationship Management) module is installed.
Input Can be NO, YES or null (the equivalent of YES).
This field defines the holiday table that will be used to control the T24 batch cycling.
It is possible to define a BATCH.HOLIDAY value that is different to either the OFFICIAL.HOLIDAY or BRANCH.HOLIDAY.
For example the bank may decide to run a batch 365 days per year even if on some days none of the branches are open.
The holiday table defined for this field will NOT be used as a default in any date calculations made for business activities.
Mandatory input for the master company, if no input is made it will default to the value of the BATCH.HOLIDAY field in the master company record
Must be a valid entry on the REGION table, i.e. a two character country code followed by 2 numeric characters
If only the 2 character country code is input then the field value will be appended with 00
Unless GLOBAL.PROCESSING is set to Y in the SPF, SYSTEM record then this field must be the same as the BATCH.HOLIDAY field of the master company record
For a book company, this field must be same as its lead company's BATCH.HOLIDAY
Indicates the name of Financial static table file which is to be maintained under a different company to the majority of the financial static table files for this company.
This field contains the names of the Financial Static Table files which are maintained under another Company to that input for the DEFAULT FINANCIAL STATIC Tables.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-30 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Optional field; Default = Nil. Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.FIN.COM to SPCL.FIN.MNE.

Determines the default number of people who are required to AUTHORISE any changes to the database for this company, except those Users who are using versions of applications which specifically state that a different number of authorisers are required.
In the absence of any other value for a particular version of an application, this value is taken as the number of authorisers required to authorise any input.
1 numeric character - Only 1 or 2 are valid values. (Mandatory input)
Indicates whether the Company record has been set for consolidation purposes only, or the company is a full processing company.
This field indicates why this company record was created:
A value of N indicates that the company is a live processing company and was created within installation of a new company routine.
A value of C indicates that the company is for consolidation only and that it was created through the normal running of the application Company.

A value of R indicates that the company has been created for reporting purposes within installation of a new company routine. Reporting companies are used to Import the CRB (Central Reporting Base) files so that consideration of CRB reports is possible across separate T24 databases.

A value of A is meant as Accounting Company. This will be linked to normal business company, when more than one set of balances reports are required from the same company, e.g. to report onshore and offshore transactions booked and owned by the same operational company in separate books
Note : Consolidation companies are yet to be processed by the systems.
1 alpha character - Only C, N or R are valid. (Mandatory input) Cannot be changed.
If C(consolidation), no further data is allowed in this Company record. Any further input will be systematically refused.
The value of 'N' may not be entered manually into a new Company record. In this respect, the record must be loaded through the installation process as described in the Overview.
If R (Reporting), no further data is allowed in this company record except for fields CURRENCY, COMPANY and APPLICATIONS.
Indicates the sub division code for the Nostro company.
This field is only used once a company's record has been read into the memory of the computer.
If Nostro accounts are maintained in another company then the Sub division code from the Nostro company record is stored in this field.
If Nostro accounts are maintained in the company being processed then this field is left blank.
4 numeric digits. (Internal Processing Field always blank displayed.)
Indicates the calculation period for charges.
Used by the interest and charges system.
1 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character. The following values will be accepted: M = Monthly Q = Quarterly S = Six monthly (Mandatory input)
Identifies the person to whom the Company Management reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Management Information reports which are produced for the whole of the company rather than for a particular department/area.
Up to 20 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
Identifies the group to which this company belongs.
Used in global processing where group companies can have the COB processing run at the same time.
Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 3 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the COMPANY.GROUP file.
Indicates the name of customer table file which is to be maintained under a different company to the majority of the customer table files for this company.
This field is only required if the Customer level files are to be maintained under the Company entered in COMPANY.CODE.
This field contains the names of the Customer Table files which are maintained under another Customer level Company to that input for the DEFAULT.CUST.COM.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-30 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Optional field. Default = Nil. Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.CUST.COM to SPCL.CUST.MNE.
Indicates under which company the Special Customer table file is maintained.

This field is only required if the Customer level files are to be maintained under the Company entered in COMPANY.CODE, and Customer Table file(s) are to be maintained under another Customer level Company to that input for the Default Customer Tables.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and can not be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record which already has Customer level files maintained for it or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details re file structure.

2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default = COMPANY.CODE if SPCL.COST.FILE' entered. Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.CUST.FILE to SPCL.CUST.MNE.
Indicates under which company the Currency files are maintained for this Company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.

The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record already existing, in which case the local currency must be the same as on this record, or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details regarding file structure.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL Optional field. Default = COMPANY.CODE. After the record has been authorised, this is a no change field.
Identifies the location to which Company Management reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Management Information reports which are produced for the whole of the company rather than for a particular department/area.
The purpose of this field is to indicate the Delivery point within the Company buildings. (e.g. floor/office number/reference).
Up to 10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
This multi-valued field is used to define ad hic days when this branch is closed.
For example a branch may normally be open 365 days per year but may be closed for 1 day per year but not on the same day every year.
In a multi branch (company) environment branches may be grouped together to use the same holiday table, even though they may be closed on different days.
When the relevant holiday table is used in a date calculation then it will be amended in memory with any branch-closed days, without affecting the record stored in the database.
This field can be amended / cleared at the banks discretion.
It is not intended that this field be used to store regular holidays in this case an appropriate holiday table should be set up.
Optional input
Standard date field
Indicates how long prospective customer details are held in the system before removal.
Input is only allowed if the CR (Customer Relationship management) module is installed.
Input should be the number of days or months information is held.
For example under the UK data protection act prspective customer details can be held for a maximum of 6 months.

A prospective customer will become a normal "active" customer as soon as they have a business relationship witht he bank, for example if they open an account, or a limit or contract is initiated for them.

A COB job CUSTOMER.PURGE will run by default on a daily basis and will check to see if any prospective customers are to be removed. If this is the case all information relating to the customer including customer history data will be deleted.

Input should be a number followed by D (Days) or M (Months), e.g. 180d indicates that prospective data will be held for 180 days, and if the customer does not become active or has further contact with the bank then their data will be removed.

This field will contain a value if the company is part of a branch setup. This type of company can either be a Lead company with branches linked to it, or a branch linked to a Lead company. If this field is blank then the company does not have any branches linked to it. In an Extended Multi Company system it is possible to have a mixture of lead companies with no branches and Lead company with branches.

This field will be used by the Data Capture Application, when the operator requests the automatic adjustment facility for the closing of a Data Capture batch. It identifies the tolerance rate checking for the automatic adjustment.
The detailed use of this field, as well as various examples, can be found in the Data Capture System guide.
Standard 'R' (rate) format i.e. up to 10 (6 integers/9 decimals) numeric characters + '.'. Optional input.
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Currency files are maintained for this.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)
Indicates under which company the Customer table files are maintained if the Customer files are maintained for this Company.

This field is only required if the Customer level files are to be maintained under the Company entered in the COMPANY.CODE field. In this case, this field will default to the COMPANY.CODE. Otherwise it is left blank.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
The Company code loaded in this special routine must be either for a Company record which already has Customer level files maintained for it or for the Company being loaded.
See CUSTOMER.COMPANY for details regarding file structure.
2-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Standard format : CCGGGLLLL (Optional field; Default, see below.) Once the record has been authorised, this is a no change field.
This field specifies the name of the local Central Bank processing.
Input to this field means that local Central Bank processing is to take place.
Up to 8 alphanumeric (type A) characters. (Optional input).
The LOCAL.PROCESS.NAME entered must be the ID of an existing record on the file BANK.RETURN.PARAMS.
Indicates the category code to be used on inter company accounting entries.
This field is only used once a company's record has been read into the memory of the computer.
If Nostro accounts are maintained in another company then the Category code from the ACCOUNT.CLASS record INTERCO is stored in this field.
If Nostro accounts are maintained in the company being processed then this field is left blank.
5 numeric digits. (Internal Processing Field always blank displayed.)
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Special Financial Static table file is maintained.
This field is only required if Financial Static Table file(s) are to be maintained under another Company to that input for the Default Financial Static Tables field 25.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.) Multivalue Associated field with field range SPCL.FIN.FILE to SPCL.FIN.COM.
Indicates the Mnemonic code for the company under which the Financial Financial table files are maintained for this company.
This field is set up when loading a new company record and cannot be changed.
2-3 type MNE (0-9 or A-Z uppercase alpha) characters or '.'. First character must be alpha. (Internal field.)
Indicates the time of this company relative to the machine where the database resides.
For exmample a single data base in one country could support companies in several time zones. Minaly used for enrichment purposes
Defines the Official business holiday table for the local country related to this company.
This field will be used to control the update of the LOCAL.COUNTRY field, which is now made no input.
2 character country code, or 2 character country code appended with 00
If only 2 characters are entered then
The last 2 characters must be 00
A value must be present in this field
Identifies the person to whom the Statutory reports are to be sent.
This data will be printed as part of the page heading details on Statutory reports produced from the Reporting module.
Up to 20 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input - no default value.)
Specifies the last financial year end.
When loading a new company record this field is set up with the previous year end by subtracting one year from the date entered in the FINANCIAL.YEAR.END.
Thereafter this field is updated at each financial year end.
The date in this field is used when calculating and raising adjustments for previous years interest.
1-9 date characters. (Internal field.)
Introduced in G13.2.

Specifies the ID of the Company whose consolidation definition would be used for this Company. Company specific consolidation definition is used to determine the Company specific (second) component of consolidation files' record keys.

The variable parameters in the consolidation file (CONSOLIDATE.ASST.LIAB and CONSOLIDATE.PRFT.LOSS) record keys could have two components separated by '_', the first one from default consolidation definition and second one from Company specific consolidation definition. The default component is determined by the CONSOLIDATE.COND records with the IDs ASSET&LIAB and PROFIT&LOSS. The Company specific component is determined by the CONSOLIDATE.COND records with the IDs ASSET&LIAB.xxxxxxxxx and PROFIT&LOSS.xxxxxxxxx, if they exist, where xxxxxxxxx is the ID of the COMPANY.

If two or more Companies share the same Company specific consolidation definitions, then it is not necessary to define separate Company specific CONSOLIDATE.COND records for each Company. It is enough if the Company specific CONSOLIDATE.COND records are defined for one Company only and other Companies are allowed to share that definition. The ID of the Company whose Company specific CONSOLIDATE.COND records need to be shared, is attached to this field in the COMPANY record of the sharing Companies.

If no value is specified in this field, it is equivalent to attaching the same Company ID, in which case, the Company specific CONSOLIDATE.COND records of the current Company would be used to determine the second component of consolidation key variables.

For example, the Companies CO2 (ID: US0010002) and CO3 (ID:US0010003) share the same Company specific consolidation definition. The records ASSET&LIAB.US0010002 and PROFIT&LOSS.US0010002 are defined in CONSOLIDATE.COND. In the Company record of US0010003, the field CONS.KEY.CO is updated with the value of US0010002. In this case, the Company CO3 would use the CONSOLIDATE.COND records ASSET&LIAB.US0010002 and PROFIT&LOSS.US0010002 to determine the Company specific components of consolidation key variables.
Should be the ID of a valid operational Company.
Optional field.
Indicates the number of months without customer activity before an account is declared as inactive.
This value is used when checking an account as being inactive.
1-2 numeric characters. (Mandatory input)
This field is derived from the COMPANY.CREATE application and indicates whether this is a Lead Company or a branch company.
If the company code in this field is equal to the key of this company record then this is a Lead company and it will own its own set of financial files (e.g. ACCOUNT).

If the company code is not equal to the key ot this record then this company is a branch linked to the Lead company defined here and it will use the same data files as the Lead company with the exception of Financail reporting files (FRP type).
Indicates the variance above which when checking the conversion of amounts for which no override will be allowed.
When on a Transaction (DATA.CAPTURE for example) two currency amounts are input, the system will check the calculation using the rate input or derived from the CURRENCY table.
If the difference, between the amount input and that calculated, when converted into local currency is less than or equal to the amount entered in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MIN then no override is necessary.
If the difference is greater than the amount entered in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MIN but less than or equal to the amount entered here then an override will be required.
If the difference is greater than the amount entered here then an error message will be displayed.
1-6 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters according to local currency. (Mandatory input) The amount entered here must be greater than or equal to the amount entered in FCY.CONV.TOLER.MIN.
If the mnemonic in this field is equal to the MNEMONIC field fo this company record then this is a Lead company and it will own its own set of financial files (e.g. ACCOUNT).

If it is not equal to the MNEMONIC of this record then this company is a branch linked to the Lead company defined here and it will use the same data files as the Lead company with the exception of Financail reporting files (FRP type).
Contains the name describing the company which enables it to be identified and is used for reporting.
This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the description of the Company in various languages.
3-22 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. Multivalue field. (Mandatory Input)
Defines the default EB.RATING.AGENCY for this company.
Must be present on EB.RATING.AGENCY
Holds the local zone name.
Local zone names are available only when the USE.LOCAL.TIME field is set to YES ,in SPF.
Transactions processed in a company, uses the local zone name specified in the TIME.ZONE field.
Validation Rules:
Any type field.
Accepts only valid zone names that are specified in EB.TIME.ZONES application.
Mandatory field for Master and Lead Company.
Optional field for Book Company.
Identifies, in countries like Belgium and Luxembourg, the Bank Prefix which is part of the local account number.
In countries like Belgium and Luxembourg, each bank receives a range or a unique identification numbers.
This may be used with the following checkdigit types:
'1' - 3 numeric '2' - 2 numeric '3' - any value '4' - 2 numeric @routine - up to 6 numeric
Note : Once a customer account record has been authorised in this company, this field may no longer be changed.
Up to 6 numeric characters. Multivalue field.
Identifies the mask the user wants to apply to customer type accounts. The mask for internal accounts is hardcoded (###-#####-####).
Examples:
4-20 alphanumeric characters.
Mandatory input.
Input in this field must contain 4 '#' characters as a minimum. The number of '#' characters defines the maximum length of the account number.
When ACCT.CHECKDIG.TYPE = 1, input in this field must contain 12 '#' characters.
When ACCT.CHECKDIG.TYPE = 2, input in this field must contain 10 '#' characters.

Characters '0 to 9', 'A to Z', 'a to z' are not allowed. The only exception being that the 1st character can be 'R' which means that the account number will be right adjusted and that it may contain leading zeros.
Identifies the check digit calculation method for the company being entered.
The following values will be accepted:
'1' : When LOCAL.CURRENCY starts with BE (i.e. identifies Belgium).
'2' : When LOCAL.CURRENCY starts with LU (i.e. identifies Luxembourg).
'3' : For 10 digit account numbers with a modules 11 check.

'4' : For 11 digit account numbers constructed with a 2 digit bank number prefix defined in ACC.BKNO.PREFIX, followed by 7 identifying digits and a 2 digit mod 11 checkdigit. The prefix may contain leading zeros.
'5' : For a standard checkdigit calculation with the account numbers zero filled to the ACCOUNT.MASK.
'6' : For a 12-14 digit number with 2 checkdgits, the first 6 digits, the second on the remaining digits. The checkdigits are calculated using mod 11.
'99' : No checkdigit calculation with the account number zero filled to the ACCOUNT.MASK.
'@routine name' : Where a local subroutine performs the checkdigit calculation.
'blank': in all other cases.
Note : Once a customer account record has been authorised in this company, this field may no longer be changed.
The following values will be accepted: '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '99', @routine name and 'blank'. Mandatory input when LOCAL CURRENCY starts with BE or LU.
Indicates the applications which will be run for this company.
hen creating files this list of applications is used to determine the files to be created. If a fi
Files are created as part of the initial processing for the setting up of a Company record.

Applications can be added/deleted on-line. Whenever a new product is added, T24.RELEASE (the T24 upgrade process) must be run to create files for the new application and to create any data items necessary. To run T24.RELEASE, see the Installation Guide for Application Releases. Enter the application code that has been added to the company record.
See the Installation Guide for further information on installing a new product.
Note:Application codes are as listed below. Some applications must be present but some are optional.
Compulsory Applications are -
EBT24 Utility, SMS and General files. ACAccounts DCData Capture DEDelivery LILimits REConsolidation and Reporting STStandard Tables

Optional Applications are - COCollateral DGDisagio FDFiduciary FFFinancial Futures FRForward Rate Agreements FTFunds Transfer FXForeign Exchange GIT24 Information Server GTT24 Transaction Server ICInterest and Charges LCLetters of Credit LDLoans and Deposits LMLoans and Money Market MCMulti-Company MDContingent Assets and Liabilities MGMortgages MMMoney Market PLProfit and Loss PMPosition Management RBRetail Banking SCSecurities TFTrade Finance TTTeller
2 type AAA (A-Z, a-z alpha) characters. Multivalue field. (Mandatory input)
The application code must already exist on the SPF (System Parameter File), in the products field
The application code must be one of the codes listed below.
The Compulsory applications must be present.
The application LM (Loans and Money Market) is required if applications LD (Loans and Deposits) and/or MM (Money Market) are loaded.
New multi valued field to identify the accounting companies linked to this type N type company
This will be a system updated field and will be updated as part of the accounting company creation process
Identifies the type N business company that this type A accounting company is linked to
This will be a system updated field and will be updated as part of the accounting company creation process
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
